recipes.title: Phở Bò
recipes.author: Khanh Nguyen
recipes.description: Traditional Vietnamese beef noodle soup
recipes.longDescription: Traditional Vietnamese beef noodle soup with aromatic herbs and spices, simmered for hours to create a rich, clear broth.
steps: Char onion and ginger over open flame
Boil bones for 30 minutes, then drain and rinse
Simmer broth with spices for 2-3 hours
Cook rice noodles separately
Slice beef brisket thinly
Assemble bowls and pour hot broth
Serve with fresh herbs and lime

recipes.title: Bánh Mì Thịt Nướng
recipes.author: Tran Le
recipes.description: Vietnamese grilled pork sandwich
recipes.longDescription: Vietnamese grilled pork sandwich with pickled vegetables, fresh herbs, and homemade pâté in a crispy baguette.
steps: Marinate pork with lemongrass and fish sauce for 30 minutes
Grill pork until charred and cooked through
Prepare pickled carrots and daikon
Split and toast baguettes lightly
Spread mayo and pâté on bread
Layer with pork, pickled vegetables, and herbs
Serve immediately while warm

recipes.title: Spaghetti Carbonara
recipes.author: Nhung Vo
recipes.description: Classic Italian pasta with eggs and cheese
recipes.longDescription: Classic Roman pasta dish with eggs, cheese, and crispy pancetta, creating a silky, creamy sauce without cream.
steps: Cook spaghetti in salted water until al dente
Dice and crisp pancetta in a large pan
Whisk eggs with grated cheeses and pepper
Reserve pasta water before draining
Toss hot pasta with pancetta off heat
Quickly mix in egg mixture with pasta water
Serve immediately with extra cheese

recipes.title: Pad Thai
recipes.author: Nhu Tang
recipes.description: Thai stir-fried noodles
recipes.longDescription: Thailand's signature stir-fried noodle dish with tamarind sauce, creating perfect balance of sweet, sour, and savory.
steps: Soak rice noodles in warm water until soft
Mix tamarind, fish sauce, and sugar for sauce
Scramble eggs and set aside
Stir-fry shrimp until pink
Add noodles and sauce, toss well
Add bean sprouts and scrambled eggs
Garnish with peanuts and lime

recipes.title: Fish Tacos
recipes.author: Khanh Nguyen
recipes.description: Fresh white fish tacos with slaw
recipes.longDescription: Baja-style fish tacos with flaky seasoned fish, tangy cabbage slaw, and zesty lime crema.
steps: Season fish with spices
Pan-fry fish until flaky
Shred cabbage for slaw
Mix sour cream with lime juice
Warm tortillas on griddle
Assemble tacos with all components
Serve with lime wedges

recipes.title: Vietnamese Iced Coffee
recipes.author: Khanh Nguyen
recipes.description: Strong Vietnamese coffee with condensed milk served over ice.
recipes.longDescription: A bold and sweet drink made from strong drip-brewed Vietnamese coffee combined with creamy condensed milk, poured over ice.
steps: Brew coffee using a Vietnamese drip filter (phin).
Add condensed milk to a glass.
Pour brewed coffee into the glass and stir.
Add ice cubes and serve.

recipes.title: Vietnamese Iced Tea
recipes.author: Khanh Nguyen
recipes.description: Refreshing iced green tea, a common drink in Vietnam.
recipes.longDescription: Vietnamese iced tea (Trà đá) is a simple and refreshing drink made with green tea leaves and served over ice, often enjoyed at street-side eateries.
steps: Steep green tea leaves in hot water for 5 minutes.
Strain the tea into a jug.
Add ice cubes and serve chilled.

recipes.title: Sugarcane Juice
recipes.author: Nhu Tang
recipes.description: Sweet and refreshing juice extracted from sugarcane.
recipes.longDescription: Nước mía is a popular Vietnamese street drink made by pressing sugarcane stalks to extract their naturally sweet juice, often served with ice.
steps: Press sugarcane stalks through a juicer.
Pour juice into a glass.
Add ice cubes and serve immediately.

recipes.title: Three-Color Dessert Drink
recipes.author: Nhu Tang
recipes.description: Colorful Vietnamese sweet drink with beans, jelly, and coconut milk.
recipes.longDescription: Chè Ba Màu (Three-Color Dessert Drink) is a refreshing Vietnamese drink made of mung beans, red beans, pandan jelly, and coconut milk, topped with crushed ice.
steps: Cook mung beans and red beans until soft.
Prepare pandan jelly and cut into strips.
Layer beans and jelly into a glass.
Pour coconut milk and sugar syrup.
Top with crushed ice and serve.

recipes.title: Mango Smoothie
recipes.author: Tran Le
recipes.description: Creamy and tropical Vietnamese mango smoothie.
recipes.longDescription: Sinh tố xoài is a tropical Vietnamese fruit smoothie made with ripe mango, milk, and ice, blended until smooth and creamy.
steps: Peel and cut mango into chunks.
Add mango, condensed milk, fresh milk, and ice to a blender.
Blend until smooth and creamy.
Pour into glasses and serve cold.

recipes.title: Gỏi Cuốn
recipes.author: Khanh Nguyen
recipes.description: Fresh Vietnamese spring rolls with shrimp, pork, and herbs.
recipes.longDescription: Gỏi cuốn is a light and healthy Vietnamese appetizer made with rice paper rolls filled with shrimp, pork, vermicelli noodles, and fresh herbs, served with peanut dipping sauce.
steps: Boil shrimp and pork, then slice thinly.
Dip rice paper in warm water until soft.
Layer noodles, herbs, shrimp, and pork.
Roll tightly and serve with dipping sauce.

recipes.title: Chả Giò
recipes.author: Tran Le
recipes.description: Vietnamese crispy fried spring rolls filled with pork and vegetables.
recipes.longDescription: Chả giò is a popular Vietnamese appetizer made with rice paper wrappers filled with minced pork, shrimp, taro, carrots, and glass noodles, then deep fried until golden and crispy.
steps: Mix pork, shrimp, and vegetables together.
Wrap filling in rice paper rolls.
Deep fry until golden brown.
Serve with fish sauce dip.

recipes.title: Bánh Khọt
recipes.author: Nhung Vo
recipes.description: Mini savory Vietnamese pancakes with shrimp.
recipes.longDescription: Bánh khọt are bite-sized savory pancakes made with rice flour batter, topped with shrimp, fried until crispy, and served with fresh vegetables and dipping sauce.
steps: Mix rice flour batter with coconut milk.
Pour batter into small molds.
Top with shrimp and cook until crispy.
Serve with vegetables and dipping sauce.

recipes.title: Bánh Bèo
recipes.author: Nhu Tang
recipes.description: Steamed rice cakes topped with dried shrimp and scallions.
recipes.longDescription: Bánh bèo is a traditional Vietnamese appetizer from Hue, consisting of steamed rice cakes topped with dried shrimp, scallion oil, and crispy pork skin.
steps: Mix rice flour and tapioca flour with water.
Steam batter in small cups.
Top with dried shrimp and scallion oil.
Serve with fish sauce dip.

recipes.title: Nộm Đu Đủ
recipes.author: Guest User
recipes.description: Vietnamese green papaya salad with herbs and peanuts.
recipes.longDescription: Nộm đu đủ is a refreshing salad made with shredded green papaya, herbs, and roasted peanuts, tossed with a tangy fish sauce dressing.
steps: Shred green papaya and carrot.
Mix with herbs and peanuts.
Toss with fish sauce dressing.
Serve chilled.

recipes.title: Pancakes
recipes.author: Khanh Nguyen
recipes.description: Fluffy American-style pancakes served with maple syrup.
recipes.longDescription: Pancakes are a classic American breakfast dish made from a simple batter of flour, eggs, milk, and baking powder, cooked until fluffy and golden brown, and often served with butter and maple syrup.
steps: Mix flour, baking powder, egg, and milk into a smooth batter.
Heat a pan and pour batter to form pancakes.
Cook until golden on both sides.
Serve with butter and maple syrup.

recipes.title: Cháo Lòng
recipes.author: Tran Le
recipes.description: Vietnamese rice porridge with pork innards.
recipes.longDescription: Cháo lòng is a traditional Vietnamese rice porridge served with pork innards, blood pudding, and fresh herbs. It's a popular breakfast dish across Vietnam.
steps: Cook rice with water until porridge consistency.
Boil and clean pork innards.
Slice innards and add to porridge.
Season with fish sauce and serve with herbs.

recipes.title: Croissant with Butter & Jam
recipes.author: Nhung Vo
recipes.description: Classic French croissant served with butter and fruit jam.
recipes.longDescription: The croissant is a buttery, flaky pastry of French origin, enjoyed at breakfast with butter and fruit jam. Its light texture and rich flavor make it a beloved European breakfast staple.
steps: Warm croissants in the oven for a few minutes.
Spread butter on each croissant half.
Add a layer of fruit jam.
Serve warm with coffee or tea.

recipes.title: Xôi Mặn
recipes.author: Nhu Tang
recipes.description: Vietnamese savory sticky rice with toppings.
recipes.longDescription: Xôi mặn is a popular Vietnamese breakfast made from sticky rice, Chinese sausage, shredded pork, quail eggs, and scallions. It's a filling and flavorful morning dish.
steps: Soak sticky rice overnight and steam until cooked.
Fry Chinese sausage and slice thinly.
Boil quail eggs and peel.
Assemble with shredded pork and scallion oil.

recipes.title: Bánh Cuốn
recipes.author: Guest User
recipes.description: Vietnamese steamed rice rolls filled with pork and mushrooms.
recipes.longDescription: Bánh cuốn are delicate steamed rice rolls filled with minced pork, mushrooms, and shallots, served with fish sauce dipping sauce and herbs. A light yet satisfying breakfast.
steps: Mix rice flour with water to create batter.
Steam thin rice sheets.
Fill with minced pork and mushrooms.
Roll and serve with dipping sauce.

recipes.title: Honey Roasted Carrots
recipes.author: Tran Le
recipes.description: Sweet and tender carrots roasted with honey and a touch of thyme.
recipes.longDescription: Honey Roasted Carrots are a simple and delicious side dish perfect for any meal. Carrots are tossed with honey, olive oil, and fresh thyme, then roasted until caramelized and tender, bringing out their natural sweetness.
steps: Preheat oven to 200°C (400°F).
Peel and cut the carrots into evenly sized sticks.
In a bowl, toss carrots with olive oil, honey, thyme, salt, and pepper.
Spread carrots on a baking sheet in a single layer.
Roast for 20–25 minutes, stirring halfway through, until tender and caramelized.
Serve warm as a sweet and savory side dish.

recipes.title: Creamy Mashed Potatoes
recipes.author: Tran Le
recipes.description: Classic creamy mashed potatoes with butter and cream.
recipes.longDescription: Smooth and fluffy mashed potatoes, enriched with butter and cream, a perfect comfort food side dish.
steps: Boil potatoes until tender.
Mash potatoes until smooth.
Stir in butter and cream.
Season with salt and pepper, then serve warm.

recipes.title: Korean Kimchi
recipes.author: Nhung Vo
recipes.description: Spicy fermented napa cabbage with chili paste.
recipes.longDescription: Traditional Korean side dish made from napa cabbage fermented with garlic, ginger, and Korean chili paste.
steps: Salt cabbage and let sit for 2 hours.
Rinse and squeeze excess water.
Mix chili paste with garlic and ginger.
Coat cabbage with paste and ferment overnight or longer.
Serve as a spicy side dish.

recipes.title: Garlic Butter Green Beans
recipes.author: Tran Le
recipes.description: Simple and flavorful green beans sautéed with garlic and butter.
recipes.longDescription: Garlic Butter Green Beans are a quick and easy side dish that pairs well with almost any main course. Fresh green beans are blanched, then sautéed in a rich garlic butter sauce until tender-crisp and infused with flavor.
steps: Trim the ends of the green beans.
Blanch beans in boiling salted water for 2–3 minutes, then drain.
Melt butter in a large skillet over medium heat.
Add minced garlic and sauté until fragrant.
Add green beans, season with salt and pepper, and stir-fry for 2–3 minutes.
Serve warm as a side dish.

recipes.title: Caprese Salad
recipes.author: Guest User
recipes.description: Italian tomato, mozzarella, and basil salad.
recipes.longDescription: A refreshing Italian side dish with ripe tomatoes, fresh mozzarella, basil leaves, olive oil, and balsamic glaze.
steps: Slice tomatoes and mozzarella.
Layer with basil leaves.
Drizzle with olive oil and balsamic glaze.
Serve fresh as a light side dish.

recipes.title: Chocolate Lava Cake
recipes.author: Tran Le
recipes.description: Rich and gooey chocolate cake with a molten center.
recipes.longDescription: Chocolate Lava Cake is a decadent dessert with a soft, spongy exterior and a warm, gooey chocolate center. Perfect for chocolate lovers, it’s easy to prepare and makes an impressive treat for any occasion.
steps: Preheat oven to 200°C (400°F) and grease 4 ramekins with butter.
Melt dark chocolate and butter together in a heatproof bowl over simmering water, stirring until smooth.
In a separate bowl, whisk eggs, egg yolks, sugar, and vanilla until pale and thick.
Gently fold melted chocolate mixture into the egg mixture.
Sift in flour and a pinch of salt, folding until just combined.
Divide batter evenly among ramekins.
Bake for 10–12 minutes, until the edges are set but the center is soft.
Let cool for 2 minutes, then invert onto plates and serve immediately.

recipes.title: Classic Tiramisu
recipes.author: Tran Le
recipes.description: Italian coffee-flavored layered dessert.
recipes.longDescription: A classic Italian dessert made with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers, mascarpone cream, and dusted with cocoa powder.
steps: Dip ladyfingers in espresso.
Layer them in a dish with mascarpone mixture.
Repeat layers and dust with cocoa powder.
Chill for at least 2 hours before serving.

recipes.title: Mango Sticky Rice
recipes.author: Nhung Vo
recipes.description: Thai dessert with sweet mango and coconut sticky rice.
recipes.longDescription: A traditional Thai dessert combining glutinous rice cooked in coconut milk, served with ripe mango slices and a drizzle of coconut sauce.
steps: Cook sticky rice until soft.
Mix with sweetened coconut milk.
Slice ripe mango and serve alongside rice.
Drizzle with coconut sauce before serving.

recipes.title: Chocolate Brownies
recipes.author: Nhu Tang
recipes.description: Rich and fudgy chocolate brownies.
recipes.longDescription: Moist and fudgy brownies made with dark chocolate, cocoa powder, and butter, perfect as a sweet snack or dessert.
steps: Melt chocolate and butter together.
Whisk in sugar and eggs.
Stir in flour and mix until combined.
Bake until set and fudgy in the center.

recipes.title: Crème Brûlée
recipes.author: Guest User
recipes.description: French custard dessert with caramelized sugar top.
recipes.longDescription: A creamy French dessert made with rich vanilla custard, topped with a layer of caramelized sugar that cracks when tapped.
steps: Heat cream with vanilla.
Whisk yolks with sugar and slowly temper with cream.
Bake custard in ramekins until set.
Sprinkle sugar and torch until caramelized.

recipes.title: Vietnamese Rice Paper Salad (Bánh Tráng Trộn)
recipes.author: Khanh Nguyen
recipes.description: Popular Vietnamese street snack made with shredded rice paper and flavorful toppings.
recipes.longDescription: Bánh Tráng Trộn is a classic Vietnamese street food snack made from shredded rice paper mixed with dried shrimp, beef jerky, quail eggs, herbs, and a tangy-sweet sauce.
steps: Cut rice paper into thin strips.
Mix with dried shrimp, beef jerky, and herbs.
Add quail eggs and drizzle with sauce.
Toss well and serve immediately.

recipes.title: Caramel Popcorn
recipes.author: Tran Le
recipes.description: Sweet and crunchy caramel-coated popcorn.
recipes.longDescription: Caramel popcorn is a classic snack where freshly popped corn is coated with a buttery caramel glaze, baked until crisp and crunchy.
steps: Pop the popcorn kernels and place in a large bowl.
Melt butter with brown sugar and corn syrup.
Pour caramel mixture over popcorn and stir to coat.
Bake until crisp and golden.

recipes.title: Crispy Seaweed Chips
recipes.author: Nhung Vo
recipes.description: Light, crunchy, and savory baked seaweed chips.
recipes.longDescription: Crispy Seaweed Chips are a light and addictive snack made by brushing nori sheets with sesame oil and soy sauce, then baking until perfectly crunchy. Sprinkled with sesame seeds for extra flavor, they are a healthy alternative to fried chips.
steps: Preheat oven to 150°C (300°F).
Cut the seaweed sheets into halves or quarters.
Mix sesame oil, soy sauce, and salt in a small bowl.
Brush the mixture lightly onto seaweed pieces.
Place on a parchment-lined tray, sprinkle with sesame seeds.
Bake for 8–10 minutes until crisp.
Cool and enjoy immediately or store in an airtight container.

recipes.title: Crispy French Fries
recipes.author: Nhu Tang
recipes.description: Golden and crispy homemade fries.
recipes.longDescription: Homemade French fries made with potatoes cut into strips, soaked, fried twice for extra crispiness, and seasoned with salt.
steps: Peel and cut potatoes into strips.
Soak in water to remove starch.
Fry once at lower temperature, then again at high heat.
Season with salt and serve hot.

recipes.title: Vietnamese Fermented Pork Roll (Nem Chua)
recipes.author: Guest User
recipes.description: Tangy and savory Vietnamese fermented pork snack.
recipes.longDescription: Nem Chua is a Vietnamese specialty made of minced pork, garlic, and chili, wrapped in banana leaves and fermented naturally to develop a tangy, savory flavor.
steps: Mix minced pork with garlic, chili, and seasoning.
Wrap in banana leaves tightly.
Leave to ferment at room temperature for 2 days.
Serve as a snack or appetizer.

ratings.comment: Tuyệt vời! Nước dùng rất đậm đà, giống như ở quán phở ngoài hàng.
Amazing broth! Took me 4 hours but totally worth it.
Authentic Vietnamese flavor, will make again!
Perfect balance of flavors! The pickled vegetables make it authentic.
Bánh mì ngon tuyệt! Thịt nướng mềm và thơm.
The sauce was so creamy! Best carbonara recipe I've tried.
Classic recipe! The key is to work quickly with the eggs.
Authentic flavors! Just like the street vendors in Bangkok.
Good recipe but needs more tamarind for authentic taste.
Fresh and light! The lime crema makes it special.
Love these fish tacos! So fresh and flavorful.
So delicious, just like the street coffee I had in Hanoi.
Tasty but hơi strong for me.
Refreshing and light, rất hợp uống buổi sáng.
Good flavor but a bit too sweet cho mình.
So fresh! Nước dừa mát lạnh đúng chuẩn Việt Nam.
Simple, natural, but hơi nhạt nếu không thêm đá.
Love the taste, trà xanh này really relaxing.
Ngon nhưng hơi đắng nếu uống không đường.
Sweet and creamy, sữa đậu nành này perfect for breakfast.
Quite good, nhưng mình thích ít ngọt hơn.
Fresh and tasty spring rolls. Love the dipping sauce!
Good balance of herbs and shrimp, but could use more greens.
Bruschetta is crispy and fresh. Perfect for a quick snack.
Simple but delicious, tomatoes are very fresh.
Spicy Thai spring rolls, very tasty.
Nice Thai flavors, a bit spicy but very flavorful.
Cheesy nachos, fun to eat. Great for sharing.
Crispy and flavorful, but a bit too much cheese.
Crispy spring rolls, just like homemade.
Crispy and delicious, but a little oily.
Pancakes are soft and fluffy. Just like American style.
Tasty, but I prefer more syrup.
Rich and hearty porridge, just like home.
Good, but a bit too strong for breakfast.
Buttery croissant, delicious with strawberry jam.
Light breakfast, classic French style.
Sticky rice full of toppings, very filling.
Good flavor, but a little too salty.
Soft and fragrant, delicious with fish sauce.
Delicate and tasty, but takes time to prepare.
The garlic green beans were perfectly cooked, still crisp with a wonderful aroma of garlic. Simple but really satisfying.
Great balance of flavor! I loved how the seasoning enhanced the beans without overpowering them.
Crispy roasted potatoes with rosemary and garlic were absolutely delicious. Golden on the outside, fluffy inside.
A classic side dish, but this version really stands out. Perfectly seasoned and roasted just right.
The coleslaw was fresh, creamy, and had just the right crunch. Perfect complement to grilled meats.
Loved the tangy dressing and the mix of vegetables. Very refreshing and balanced.
Steamed rice was fluffy and perfectly cooked. A staple done really well!
Simple but essential. The rice had a light texture and no stickiness. Excellent base for any dish.
The sautéed spinach with garlic was tender and flavorful. Light, healthy, and tasty.
Really enjoyed the freshness of the spinach. Garlic added a nice kick without being overwhelming.
The chocolate lava cake was rich and indulgent, with a perfectly gooey center. Absolutely heavenly.
Decadent dessert! The balance between the soft cake and molten chocolate was spot on.
Fresh fruit salad with honey dressing was light, refreshing, and beautifully colorful.
I loved the mix of fruits and the subtle sweetness of honey. Very refreshing!
The tiramisu was creamy, rich, and had just the right coffee flavor. A true classic done well.
Delicious layers of mascarpone and espresso-soaked ladyfingers. Smooth and indulgent.
Cheesecake had a creamy filling and buttery crust. Not too sweet, just perfect.
Smooth, creamy, and with a delightful crust. A dessert I’d gladly eat again.
Banana fritters were golden and crispy outside, soft and sweet inside. A nostalgic treat.
Perfectly fried and not too oily. The bananas melted in the mouth. Lovely dessert!
Spring rolls were fresh, vibrant, and packed with crisp vegetables. Peanut dipping sauce was excellent.
Loved the fresh herbs and rice paper wrap. So refreshing and light.
Popcorn was buttery, crisp, and addictive. Perfect snack for a movie night.
Light and crunchy, not overly salty. A simple but satisfying snack.
Great texture and flavor in every bite.
Crispy chips with amazing salty flavour. Delicious snack to share.
French fries were golden, crispy, and seasoned perfectly. Classic comfort food.
Crispy on the outside and fluffy inside. Simple but done so well.
The pretzels were soft and chewy with a perfect salty crust. Warm and comforting.
Wonderful texture and flavor. I especially liked them fresh out of the oven.
